intro: Gomphrena dispersa, commonly known as the scattered gomphrena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, spiky inflorescences that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is often found in disturbed soils. Its foliage is lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought tolerance. Gomphrena dispersa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
